name: Tinker Joe

topics.response_text: Various things. You never know what might come in handy.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to buy a robot.
topics.response_text: Of course you would, of course! Well, it just happens that I've got a beaut of a deal on this customized Gutsy.

topics.topic_text: You just don't want to sell to me, is that it?
topics.response_text: Trust me, friend, Tinker Joe does not turn down the opportunity to make a sale. If that Gutsy would go with you, I'd sell him in a heartbeat.

topics.topic_text: That's a lot of caps, but I guess it's a pretty rare find.
topics.response_text: Hey, I said it was a beaut of a deal, didn't I?

topics.topic_text: How about this: I'll take him off your hands for 500 caps.
topics.response_text: That's a hard bargain. But if I wake up with that thing playing revelry at me one more time, I'll go insane.

topics.topic_text: I'll pass. I don't need a crazy, robotic soldier following me around.
topics.response_text: You say that now, but you might end up reconsidering that when you're surrounded by radscorpions.{Mildly chiding}
Hello, stranger. I'm Tinker Joe, premier supplier of robotic parts and service throughout the DC Wasteland.

description:
Tinker Joe is a 72 year-old Asian Male.

An elderly Asian man with weathered skin and calloused hands from years of tinkering with machinery. Tinker Joe travels the Capital Wasteland as a merchant, his cart pulled by a Brahmin named Bessie. He's accompanied by an old Mister Gutsy unit named Sergeant RL-3, which plays military reveille at dawn, much to Joe's chagrin. Joe's cart is laden with various goods, from scrap metal and junk to weapons and armor.

Tinker Joe's Personality: Pragmatic and patient with most customers, but easily irritated by Sergeant RL-3's reveille. He's a shrewd businessman who values a quiet night's sleep over profit when it comes to his robotic companion. Despite his gruff exterior, he has a soft spot for fellow survivors and will sometimes offer discounts to those who help him with problems.

Tinker Joe's Backstory: Born in pre-War Chinatown, Washington D.C., Tinker Joe was an apprentice mechanic at a local electronics store before the Great War. He survived the bombs by hiding in the store's basement, emerging weeks later to find a world transformed. For decades, he wandered the wasteland, using his mechanical skills to repair and trade goods. Along his travels, he salvaged a damaged Mister Gutsy unit and repaired it, naming it Sergeant RL-3. The robot became both his companion and his greatest annoyance, playing its programmed military reveille every morning without fail.
